method.name: emulation_vxlan_config
method.description: Configures VXLAN emulation for the specified test port or handle.

description.text: Action to take on the port specified the handle argument.

choice.choiceText: Adds a new VXLAN configuration on the port.
Modifies an existing VXLAN configuration (specified by -handle).
Remove an existing VXLAN configuration (specified by -handle).

description.text: Specifies the port and group upon which emulation is configured. If the -mode is "modify", -handle specifies the group upon which emulation is configured, otherwise it specifies the session upon which emulation is configured

If enabled creates behind the VXLAN device group a chained device group with IPv4 and Ethernet stacks emulating the connected VMs. If not enabled only the VXLAN device group will be created. Valid options: 0 - Disabled 1 - Enabled This option is valid only when -handle is a port handle.
The VXLAN version to be emulated. CHOICES: vxlan vxlanv6.
This is the name of the protocol stack as it appears in the GUI.
The MAC address for the interface to be created.
The incrementing step for the MAC address of the interface to be created.
The maximum transmission unit for the interfaces created with this range.
Indicates the number of IP address clients emulated.
Indicates the multiplier per VXLAN entity for behind VM clients emulated.
The first VLAN ID to be used for the outer VLAN tag.
The value to be added to the outer VLAN ID for each new assignment.
The 802.1Q priority for the outer VLAN.
The IP address of the simulated VTEP. If -ip_num_sessions is > 1, this IP address will increment by value specified in -intf_ip_addr_step.
This value will be used for incrementing the IP address of simulated VTEP if -count is > 1.
Defines the mask of the IP address used for the Ixia (-intf_ip_addr) and the DUT interface.
VXLAN Network Identifier.
IPv4 Multicast Address.
IPv6 Multicast Address.
Enable Unicast Info.
Unicast Info Count.
Remote VTEP Ipv4.
Remote VTEP Unicast IPv6.
Suppress Arp for each Remote VM defined.
Statically configure the Remote Inner Mac address to Outer Vtep IPv6 mapping, used for traffic.
Remote VM MAC.
Remote VM Ipv4.
Activates the Unicast Info for each Remote VM.
Configures the custom multiplier between stack elements (IPv4 and VXLAN stacks)
Number of times an action is triggered per time interval This option configures a global protocol parameter and is available only with /globals handle.
Number of times an action is triggered per time interval. This option configures a global protocol parameter and is available only with /globals handle.
Time interval used to calculate the rate for triggering an action. This option configures a global protocol parameter and is available only with /globals handle.
The number of triggered instances of an action that are still awaiting a response of completion. This option configures a global protocol parameter and is available only with /globals handle.
Indicates whether the control is specified per port or per device group. This option configures a global protocol parameter and is available only with /globals handle.

choice.choiceText: The values regarding stop rate are mapped per device group
The values regarding stop rate are mapped per port

description.text: Number of times an action is triggered per time interval. This option configures a global protocol parameter and is available only with /globals handle.
Number of times an action is triggered per time interval. This option configures a global protocol parameter and is available only with /globals handle.
Time interval used to calculate the rate for triggering an action. This option configures a global protocol parameter and is available only with /globals handle.
The number of triggered instances of an action that are still awaiting a response of completion. This option configures a global protocol parameter and is available only with /globals handle.
Indicates whether the control is specified per port or per device group. This option configures a global protocol parameter and is available only with /globals handle.

choice.choiceText: The values regarding stop rate are mapped per device group
The values regarding stop rate are mapped per port

description.text: UDP Destination Port. This option configures a global protocol parameter and is available only with /globals handle.
Indicates the IGMP version used by VXLAN interfaces. This option configures a global protocol parameter and is available only with /globals handle.
Indicates what is the outer destination IP in the generated fpga traffic. This option configures a global protocol parameter and is available only with /globals handle.
The IP address of the Gateway for the Interface Interface.
This parameter is not valid on mode modify when IxTclProtocol is used. What step will be use for incrementing the -gateway option.
The first VLAN ID to be used for the outer VLAN tag. Argument configures the Ethernet stack of the chained device group/VMs.
The value to be added to the outer VLAN ID for each new assignment. Argument configures the Ethernet stack of the chained device group/VMs.
The 802.1Q priority for the outer VLAN. Argument configures the Ethernet stack of the chained device group/VMs.

List of IP addresses that configure each of the traffic generation tool interfaces. If -sessions_per_vxlan is > 1, this IP address will increment by value specified in -ig_intf_ip_addr_step. Argument configures the IPv4 stack of the chained device group/VMs.
Defines the mask of the IP address used for the Ixia (-intf_ip_addr) and the DUT interface. The range of the value is 1-32. Argument configures the IPv4 stack of the chained device group/VMs.
This value will be used for incrementing the IP address if -count is > 1. Argument configures the IPv4 stack of the chained device group/VMs.
The IP address of the Gateway. Argument configures the IPv4 stack of the chained device group/VMs.
What step will be use for incrementing the -ig_gateway option. Argument configures the IPv4 stack of the chained device group/VMs.
The MAC address for the interface to be created. Argument configures the Ethernet stack of the chained device group/VMs.
The incrementing step for the MAC address of the interface to be created. Argument configures the Ethernet stack of the chained device group/VMs.
The maximum transmission unit for the interfaces created with this range. Argument configures the Ethernet stack of the chained device group/VMs.
Autoresolve gateway MAC addresses.
The manual gateway MAC addresses. This option has no effect unless enable_resolve_gateway is set to 0.
The step of the manual gateway MAC addresses. This option has no effect unless enable_resolve_gateway is set to 0.
Autoresolve gateway MAC addresses. Argument configures the IPv4 stack of the chained device group/VMs.
The manual gateway MAC addresses. This option has no effect unless enable_resolve_gateway is set to 0. Argument configures the IPv4 stack of the chained device group/VMs.
The step of the manual gateway MAC addresses. This option has no effect unless enable_resolve_gateway is set to 0. Argument configures the IPv4 stack of the chained device group/VMs.
Pad inner frame with 0 in order to have inner frame of minimum specified size.
There will be different behaviours based on role (normal=0, ovsdb controller stack=1, bfd stack=2.
Ovsdb to Vxlan multiplier, when part of OVSDB Server stack.
If true, VXLAN will use information received from another protocol which will handle the learning mechanism.
IPv6 addresses of the layer.
IPv6 addresses step of the layer.
Gateway's IPv6 address of the layer.
Gateways IPv6 address step of the layer.
Defines the mask of the IP address used for the Ixia (-intf_ipv6_addr) and the DUT interface. This parameter is not valid on mode modify when IxTclProtocol is used. RANGE 1-128.

returnValue.value: A list containing the vxlan static info protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the vxlanv6 protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the vxlanv6 static info protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
Device handles of the VXLAN devices configured Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.
Stack handle of the VXLAN stack configured
Handle for the configured VXLAN device group
Ethernet handle for the VXLAN device group Ethernet stack
IPv4 handle for the VXLAN device group IPv4 stack
IPv6 handle for the VXLAN6 device group IPv6 stack.
Ethernet handle for the chained device group Ethernet stack
IPv4 handle for the chained device group IPv4 stack
Handle for the chained device group

notes.note: When -handle is provided with the /globals value the arguments that configure global protocol setting accept both multivalue handles and simple values. When -handle is provided with a a protocol stack handle or a protocol session handle, the arguments that configure global settings will only accept simple values. In this situation, these arguments will configure only the settings of the parent device group or the ports associated with the parent topology. If the current session or command was run with -return_detailed_handles 0 the following keys will be omitted from the command response: handle
